title: Conic Equations and Parameterizations - Part C

content.description:
The x axis ranges from negative 8 to 10 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from negative 12 to 1 in increments of 1. 

The ellipse intersects its horizontal line of symmetry at (negative 7 comma negative 7) and (9 comma negative 7). 

The ellipse intersects its vertical line of symmetry at (1 comma negative 3) and (1 comma negative 11).

Equation for hyperbola
 <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>9</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A40@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
content.question:
Part C

An equation for a hyperbola in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane is given. The hyperbola has two asymptotes. Write an equation for one of the asymptotes.

Part C

The hyperbola has two asymptotes. Write an equation for one of the asymptotes.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
